trans-unit.source: Writes current date, time and the specified text to a log file

seg-source.mrk: Writes current date, time and the specified text to a log file

target.mrk: Writes current date, time and the specified text to a log file

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Path of the file to write to, or a file handle returned from FileOpen().

seg-source.mrk: Path of the file to write to, or a file handle returned from FileOpen().

target.mrk: Path of the file to write to, or a file handle returned from FileOpen().

trans-unit.source: Message to be written to the log file

seg-source.mrk: Message to be written to the log file

target.mrk: Message to be written to the log file

trans-unit.source: [optional] Flag that defines if $sLogMsg will be written to the end of file, or to the beginning.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Flag that defines if $sLogMsg will be written to the end of file, or to the beginning.

target.mrk: [optional]
Flag that defines if $sLogMsg will be written to the end of file, or to the beginning.

trans-unit.source: If $iFlag = -1 (default) $sLogMsg will be written to the end of file.

seg-source.mrk: If $iFlag = -1 (default) $sLogMsg will be written to the end of file.

target.mrk: If $iFlag = -1 (default) $sLogMsg will be written to the end of file.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise $sLogMsg will be written to beginning of file.

seg-source.mrk: Otherwise $sLogMsg will be written to beginning of file.

target.mrk: Otherwise $sLogMsg will be written to beginning of file.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: @error:

trans-unit.source: 1 - Error opening specified file

seg-source.mrk: 1 - Error opening specified file

target.mrk: 1 - Error opening specified file

trans-unit.source: 2 - File could not be written to

target.mrk: 2 - File could not be written to
